text: Norway was represented by Ellen Nikolaysen, with the song '"Touch My Life (With Summer)", at the 1975 Eurovision Song Contest, which took place on 22 March in Stockholm. "Touch My Life (With Summer)" was chosen as the Norwegian entry at the Melodi Grand Prix on 25 January. Nikolaysen had previously sung for Norway as a member of the Bendik Singers in 1973 and had also provided backing vocals for Anne-Karine Strøm in 1974. ==Before Eurovision== === Melodi Grand Prix 1975 === The final was held at the studios of broadcaster NRK in Oslo, hosted by Bergljot Engeset. Five songs were presented in the final with each song sung twice by different singers, once with a small combo and once with a full orchestra. The winning song was chosen by voting from a 10-member "expert" jury. "Touch My Life (With Summer)" was performed in Norwegian at MGP and was translated into English before going to Stockholm.ESC National Finals database 1975 {| class="sortable wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto; text-align:center" ! colspan="13" |Detailed Jury Votes |- !Draw !Song ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! !Total |- | 1 || align=left| "En enkel sang" || 2 || 3 || 3 || 4 || 3 || 3 || 4 || 2 || 2 || 4 || 30 |- |- style="font-weight:bold; background:gold;" | 2 || align=left| "Det skulle ha vært sommer nå" || 5 || 4 || 5 || 5 || 4 || 4 || 3 || 5 || 2 || 4 || 39 |- | 3 || align=left| "1+1=2" || 1 || 2 || 4 || 4 || 2 || 1 || 1 || 3 || 1 || 4 || 23 |- | 4 || align=left| "Kjærlighetens under" || 1 || 3 || 2 || 3 ||5||5||5|| 2 || 3 || 3 || 32 |- | 5 || align=left| "Ah, du gjør meg så glad" || 1 || 1 || 1 || 2 || 2 || 2 || 2 || 1 || 1 || 3 || 16 |} == At Eurovision == During the preparation of the contest, the song Det skulle ha vært sommer nå was translated as Touch My Life (With Summer). On the night of the final Nikolaysen performed 6th in the running order, following Luxembourg and preceding Switzerland. At the close of voting, Norway picked up only 11 points (7 from Italy and 2 each from Monaco and the Netherlands), placing Norway 18th of the 19 entries, ahead only of Turkey. The Norwegian jury awarded its 12 points to contest winners the Netherlands.ESC History - Norway 1975 ==See also== *Norway in the Eurovision Song Contest *Eurovision Song Contest 1975 == References == Category:Countries in the Eurovision Song Contest 1975 Category:Norway in the Eurovision Song Contest Category:1975 in Norwegian music Category:1975 in Norwegian television
title: Norway in the Eurovision Song Contest 1975
